thread.section_title: Archive News & Video for Monday, 09 Apr 2018 | Reuters.com
thread.title: Uber has acquired electric bike-sharing startup JUMP Bikes

author: Heather Somerville
title: Uber has acquired electric bike-sharing startup JUMP Bikes
text:
SAN FRANCISCO, April 9 (Reuters) - Ride-hailing company Uber Technologies Inc said on Monday it has acquired electric bike service JUMP Bikes, in a deal that further consolidates the crowded bike-sharing industry and allows Uber to offer U.S. passengers an alternative to cars.
Uber said in a statement it had entered an agreement to buy JUMP, but an Uber spokeswoman declined to disclose the terms of the deal. JUMP is a dockless electric bike service that has rolled out in San Francisco, where it has a small presence with 250 bikes, and Washington, DC. About 100 JUMP employees will join Uber, the spokeswoman said.
Uber Chief Executive Dara Khosrowshahi said the acquisition furthers Uber’s goal of offering “the fastest or most affordable way to get where you’re going, whether that’s in an Uber, on a bike, on the subway, or more.” (Reporting by Heather Somerville Editing by Chizu Nomiyama)
